Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: this is the problem... reproduced on multiple chains and nodes now. Definatly this CC-EVAL is locking it up

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: maybe there needs to be some new lock for mining and CC eval?

Content: could the mutex and the LOCK conflict ?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: like if we made the mutex a LOCK

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: what seems to be the problem is the miner (more threads there are the worse it gets ) locks cs_main and somehow when an import tx is received to the mempool it takes this path and ends up dead locking when it gets to the mutex

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: another approach is to make sure the import isnt using anything with a lock main

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i made a myGetTransaction that doesnt lock

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if you can find what in the import validation is locking, that would be a cleaner way to solve it

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: wat does not make sends ois that the mempool is locked in the miner also, so I dont understand how its able to process the import at all.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: any CC validation is already locked

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Its strange, as there was a similar lock, that would do much the same thing (never backtraced it) that was for all tx not just CC's, that required locking cs_main and mempool.cs more often, now thats fixed I guess its exposed this problem. ONly happens when daemon PoW mining, dont think we ever saw it with PoS, but that could just have been luck.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: some function called by the CC validation is doing a lock

Content: it shouldnt be doing
